result.execSummary:
The defendant Betty J. Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Contempt of Court/Disobey Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 785.01(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution set at $49,570.68 payable to Sara Eberhardy, Guardian of the Estate of Candice S. to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid before any court costs, fees and assessments.

Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Defendant not allowed to oversee any guardians.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments during term of extended supervision on COUNT 1; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: consecutive to Count 1. Defendant eligible for good time credit.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Betty J. Coleman in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by:  Nathaniel S., Darrell G., Malcom H., and John L.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 1/2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of  3 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $49,570.68 payable to Sara Eberhardy Guardian of the Estate of Candice S. to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid before any court costs, fees and assessments  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Defendant not allowed to oversee any guardians

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, consecutive to COUNT 1.  Defendant eligible for good time credit.
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments during term of extended supervision on COUNT 1; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Betty J. Coleman in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to bothe counts and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty on both counts as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Betty J. Coleman in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared for trial.  Matter adjourned to 1:30 p.m. this date for commencement of trial.
from the State received and filed.
Letter from the District Attorney received and filed.

Defendant Betty J. Coleman in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Kurt Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Defense still in a contest posture.  Parties prepared to proceed to trial.  Case remains set for Jury Trial before Branch 21 on 07/20/2015. Discussion of Stipulation of Fact held with the defendant. Discussion of State's filed motions in limine. Court will allow for the admission of the specified documents without the testimony of an expert witness. Court will also grant the State's motion in limine requesting judicial notice of guardianship file No. 2012GN539M, and the file is ordered to be present on the day of the of the jury trial.  Discussion of the probative value of potential evidence to be used at trial. Case adjourned to Branch 21.

Defendant Betty J. Coleman in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Bruce Landgraf for Kurt Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
